title: 'For most Gazans, their days consist of queuing for water'
summary: One year after the war in Gaza started, 96% of the population still depends on international food aid, observes Antoine Renard, country director for the World Food Program in Palestine, in an interview with Le Monde.

title: At the Pelicot rape trial, a day of interrogations at breakneck speed
summary: Seven defendants were questioned by the Vaucluse criminal court on Thursday, October 3, during an extremely busy day of hearings.

title: Iran says its allies 'will not back down' in war with Israel
summary: Speaking ahead of the first anniversary of Hamas's October 7 attack on Israel that triggered the ongoing war in Gaza, Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei defended the Palestinian group's "logical and legal" actions against Israeli forces.

title: Covid-19: Two studies confirm the persistence of prolonged cognitive impairment up to one year after infection
summary: Researchers have demonstrated very mild cognitive impairment in young healthy patients one year after suffering from Covid without any complications. A second study shows that the brains of older patients with a severe form of the disease appear to have aged by 20 years.

title: 'Does the case of Sean Combs, aka Diddy, herald a #MeToo in music?'
summary: With several accusations of rape and sexual violence against him, the American rapper could become the Harvey Weinstein of the music industry. But for 30 years, Combs has benefited from an incredible level of leniency.

title: With 'Moon Music,' Coldplay's interplanetary pop goes round in circles
summary: The British band's 10th studio album focuses on its four singles to the detriment of the rest.

title: Biden says 'not confident' of peaceful US election
summary: Trump has been indicted over what prosecutors allege was a 'private criminal effort' to subvert the election that culminated in the violence on January 6, 2021 at the US Capitol.

title: Pogba's drug ban cut to 18 months from four years
summary: Pogba tested positive for testosterone in August 2023 after a match between Juventus and Udinese. His representatives said it came from a food supplement prescribed by a doctor he consulted in the United States.

title: Champagne house Taittinger brings bubbles to Kent countryside
summary: The famous label releases its first cuvée of sparkling wine from vines planted in the region of South East London. As global warming progresses, wineries are springing up all over the English countryside.

title: In Bolivia, behind the catastrophic fires, a race for agricultural growth
summary: Nearly 7 million hectares of forest and grazing land have been burnt in the South American country, which declared a state of 'national disaster' on September 30. The fires were caused by the widespread clearing of land for cultivation.

title: French actor Michel Blanc dies at 72
summary: Michel Blanc, a beloved 'worried clown' who was best known for his comedic roles, one of the very few people to win both an acting and a screenplay award at the Cannes Film Festival, died on Friday, October 4.

title: Ukrainian soldier Serhiy Hnezdilov: 'Avoiding the army has become a national sport'
summary: A voluntary 2019 recruit in the Donbas war, a 24-year-old soldier has now left his unit, protesting against the lack of prospects for demobilization and denouncing social inequalities that help some people avoid being drafted.

title: Macron warns against 'double standards' in world conflicts
summary: In a speech at a summit of French-speaking leaders, President Emmanuel Macron called for diplomacy that 'defends the sovereignty and territorial integrity everywhere,' citing conflicts from Ukraine to the Middle East.

title: An X-ray scan reveals the secrets of an Egyptian mummy from the Louvre
summary: An examination at Le Centre Hospitalier de Lens in northern France has revealed more about a scribe who died almost 3,000 years ago.

title: Kamala Harris appeals to shared patriotism in campaign stop with Liz Cheney
summary: At a rally for the Democratic candidate on Thursday, Dick Cheney's daughter called for 'putting patriotism ahead of partisanship.' The former elected official is one of the few voices within the Republican Party to consistently speak out against Donald Trump.

title: French PM Barnier asserts change of governing style
summary: In a prime-time TV interview, Michel Barnier sought to distance himself from how President Emmanuel Macron has led the country for 7 years. He held firm on plans to hike taxes for the wealthiest in order to reduce the deficit and impose strict measures on immigration.

title: EU court blocks French ban on vegetarian 'steak' labeling
summary: The Court of Justice of the EU overturned a French government ban on using words like 'steak' or 'bacon' to describe plant-based products, ruling that such terms could not be banned unless they had legal definitions.

title: Ukraine is employing increasingly controversial methods for mobilization
summary: After the legal age for enlistment was lowered from 27 to 25, the pace of recruitment accelerated. But there is considerable criticism about violence by recruiters, the social disparities in the selection of recruits and the poor quality of training for new soldiers.
